config.title: Goldilocks Noise: Breaking the Perfect Lock Trap
config.description: E107 found perfect lock (PLI=1.0) at ALL K values → classical. E103C had PLI≈0.94 with σ=0.1 noise → violations! Test: Add Gaussian noise to Kuramoto coupling to break perfect lock and enable Goldilocks regime. Prediction: σ=0.1 creates PLI≈0.9-0.95 band where |S|>2.0.

discovery.e107_trap: E107 found perfect lock (PLI=1.0) at K=0.2-0.7 → |S|≤2.0 (classical)
discovery.hypothesis: Noise breaks perfect lock → enables Goldilocks regime where violations emerge
discovery.goldilocks_principle: Too little noise → perfect lock → classical. Too much noise → forgetfulness → classical. Just right → imperfect lock → violations!

sigma_0.05.regime: Slight lock breaking → weak violations possible

sigma_0.1.regime: GOLDILOCKS: Imperfect lock → strong violations (E103C regime)

sigma_0.2.regime: Too much noise → forgetfulness → back to classical

success_criteria.primary: Find Goldilocks noise band: σ where 0.90 < PLI < 0.95 and |S| > 2.2
success_criteria.secondary: Show σ=0.0 gives PLI=1.0 and |S|≤2.0 (confirm E107 trap)
success_criteria.tertiary: Show high σ returns to classical (forgetfulness regime)

notes: This is THE experiment to prove noise breaks the trap
E107 was perfect lock everywhere → classical
E103C was σ=0.1 noise → PLI≈0.94 → violations
This tests the full noise spectrum to find the Goldilocks band
Expected: bell curve of violations at intermediate σ
